DOC.HEAD: Final Agreement Reached on $500 Million Loan to Poland
DOC.TEXT: The Treasury Department said today that final agreement had been reached to provide Poland with a temporary loan of up to $500 million to assist the country's economic reform efforts. The money is being supplied by a group of Western nations, with the U.S. share expected to total about $200 million, officials said. A Treasury statement said the $500 million short-term loan would be used to assist the country until a larger $1 billion stabilization fund for Poland became operational.
